description: Welcome to Smithsonian Open Access, where you can download, share, and reuse millions of the Smithsonian’s images—right now, without asking. With new platforms and tools, you have easier access to nearly 3 million 2D and 3D digital items from our collections—with many more to come. This includes images and data from across the Smithsonian’s 19 museums, nine research centers, libraries, archives, and the National Zoo.

access: In the Leiden University repository (https://digitalcollections.universiteitleiden.nl/view/collection/kitlvphotos) most photographs are available in TIFF; most uploaded photographs to wikimedia commons in the past are JPG. name: The Cell 12
shortDescription: The dataset consists of objects from a 29-year-old prisoner’s cell.
description: The dataset consists of objects from a 29-year-old prisoner’s cell which was included to the Prison museum collection when Hämeenlinna prison closed in 1993. The whole collection of cell 12 contains the prisoner’s personal belongings as well as the prison’s property. The prisoner already had nine prior convictions of assaults, thefts, robberies and traffic violations. His latest sentence, of some three years, he completed at his own request, in a prison near his home after Hämeenlinna prison closed.
access: The collection is accessed on a website (finna.fi) and images are in jpg format at finna.fi.

name: Collection data in Wikidata & Wikimedia Commons
shortDescription: Metadata from museum collections in Wikidata & selected photographs of paintings & buildings in Wikimedia Commons
description:
You can find our data from Wikidata:
Lönnström Art Museum (art collection of ca 350 works): https://w.wiki/GNv
Pori Art Museum (City of Pori Art collection, ca 2300 works): https://w.wiki/PrQ
Lapua City Museums (ca 60 historical photographs, including Alvar Aalto's architecture): https://w.wiki/fms
Jyväskylä University Museum (Jyväskylä University buildings including coordinates): https://w.wiki/fji

And photographs in Wikimedia Commons:
Lönnström Art Museum (ca. 50 photos of historical paintings): https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Paintings_in_the_Lonnstrom_Artmuseum
Pori Art Museum (ca. 20 photos of historical paintings & works on paper):
https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Media_from_Pori_Art_Museum
Jyväskylä University Museum (200 historical photographs) https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Collections_of_the_Jyv%C3%A4skyl%C3%A4_University_Museum
access: Collections are in Wikidata anda Wikimedia Commons
organization: Lönnström Art Museum, Pori Art Museum, Lapua City Museums, Jyväskylä University Museum
copyright: PDM / Public Domain, CC0, CC BY

name: Thomas
description: As Cultural Heritage Lead at Sketchfab I help GLAM organisations capture their collections in 3D and publish the resulting 3D models for online viewing as well as download under Creative Commons licenses.

name: Cultural Heritage 3D Models on Sketchfab
shortDescription: Sketchfab hosts 3D models from hundreds of GLAM organisations from all over the world, many thousands of which are available for download and remix under Creative Commons licenses - everything from dinosaur skeletons, ancient Egyptian statues, archaeological digs and more are available.
description:
Sketchfab hosts the largest and most diverse consolidated collection of cultural heritage 3D data. Individual GLAM organisations and projects have created profiles on sketchfab.com and uploaded their own unique 3D data to make it available for exploration and reuse by anyone online.

Uses for 3D data are diverse: you can render hi res images and video straight from the Sketchfab viewer; combine, edit & animate; 3D print; create interactive 3D games; VR & AR scenes and filters for Instagram.

We've run our own remix challenges in the past (https://sketchfab.com/blogs/community/sketchfab-remix-challenge-re-imagining-ancient-art/) and the results were wonderful (https://sketchfab.com/search?q=tag%3Achremixchallenge&sort_by=-likeCount&type=models).

We are excited to see what new possibilities the hack4openglam community dream up.
access: All 3D models are available for download in glTF and USDZ formats as well as originally uploaded formats (OBJ, FBX, PLY, STL, etc.) directly on sketchfab.com or using the Sketchfab API (https://sketchfab.com/developers)
copyright: CC0, CC BY, CC BY-SA, CC NC or ND clauses

You'll find videos, newspapers, maps, photographs, audio recordings, artworks and news reports.

name: Mapping Manuscript Migrations Knowledge Graph
shortDescription: The Mapping Manuscript Migrations knowledge graph links disparate datasets from Europe and North America to provide an international view of the history and provenance of medieval and Renaissance manuscripts.
description:
The Mapping Manuscript Migrations knowledge graph links disparate datasets from Europe and North America to provide an international view of the history and provenance of medieval and Renaissance manuscripts. Researchers are able to analyse and visualize the aggregated data at scales ranging from individual manuscripts to thousands of manuscripts.

MMM uses Linked Open Data principles and technology to combine data from three important manuscript databases:
• Schoenberg Database of Manuscripts
• Bibale
• Medieval Manuscripts in Oxford Libraries

The portal is publicly available at: https://mappingmanuscriptmigrations.org/ 

The SPARQL endpoint for the MMM data is available at: http://ldf.fi/mmm/sparql

The MMM Knowledge Graph (20+ million RDF triples) can be downloaded from Zenodo: https://zenodo.org/record/3935259

Technical documentation for the MMM project can be found on GitHub: 
https://mapping-manuscript-migrations.github.io/
access: SPARQL endpoint, RDF data in Zenodo
organization: Aalto University, Oxford e-Research Centre (the Bodleian Libraries), the University of Pennsylvania Libraries, the Institut de recherche et d’histoire des textes

name: Birger Carlstedt's artwork as open data
shortDescription: Artwork of the Finland-Swedish painter Birger Carlstedt (1907-1975) has been made available to everyone under an open license on Wikimedia Commons.
description: The artist Birger Carlstedt's (1907-1975) artwork has been made available to everyone under an open license on Wikimedia Commons. The artwork is owned by Konstsamfundet, and it is the first time an art museum opens up a collection this way while the copyright is still in force. Aided by Projekt Fredrika and Wikimedia Suomi, Konstsamfundet made Carlstedt's art available to everyone under an open license in June 2020.
access: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Birger_Carlstedt
